_**Quantum of Solace: Original Motion Picture Soundtrack**_ is the soundtrack
album for the [James Bond](/wiki/James_Bond "James Bond") film [of the same
name](/wiki/Quantum_of_Solace "Quantum of Solace"). Released on 17 October
2008. The album contains the score composed by [David
Arnold](/wiki/David_Arnold "David Arnold"). It is Arnold's fifth soundtrack
for the James Bond franchise. His frequent collaborator Nicholas Dodd
orchestrated and conducted the score.

## Contents

  * 1 Development
  * 2 Track listing
  * 3 See also
  * 4 References

##
Development[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Quantum_of_Solace_\(soundtrack\)&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Development")]

[David Arnold](/wiki/David_Arnold "David Arnold"), who composed the scores for
the previous four Bond films, said that _Quantum of Solace_ director [Marc
Forster](/wiki/Marc_Forster "Marc Forster") likes to work very closely with
his composers and that, in comparison to the accelerated schedule he was tied
to on _Casino Royale_ , the intention was to spend a long time scoring the
film to "really work it out". He also said he would be "taking a different
approach" with the score.[1] Arnold composed the music based on impressions
from reading the script, and Forster edited those into the film.[2]

[Mark Ronson](/wiki/Mark_Ronson "Mark Ronson") and [Amy
Winehouse](/wiki/Amy_Winehouse "Amy Winehouse") recorded a
[demo](/wiki/Demo_\(music\) "Demo \(music\)") track for the film,[3] but
Ronson explained that she was "not ready to record any music" at that time.[4]
It was announced [Jack White](/wiki/Jack_White_\(musician\) "Jack White
\(musician\)") of [The White Stripes](/wiki/The_White_Stripes "The White
Stripes") and [Alicia Keys](/wiki/Alicia_Keys "Alicia Keys") would collaborate
on "[Another Way to Die](/wiki/Another_Way_to_Die "Another Way to Die")",
which is the first duet in Bond music history, on 29 July 2008.[5][6] They had
wanted to work together for two years beforehand.[7] The song was recorded in
[Nashville, Tennessee](/wiki/Nashville,_Tennessee "Nashville, Tennessee");
White played the drums while Keys performed on the piano.[8] [The Memphis
Horns](/wiki/The_Memphis_Horns "The Memphis Horns") also contributed to the
track.[7] White's favourite Bond theme is [John
Barry](/wiki/John_Barry_\(composer\) "John Barry \(composer\)")'s instrumental
piece for _[On Her Majesty's Secret
Service](/wiki/On_Her_Majesty%27s_Secret_Service_\(soundtrack\) "On Her
Majesty's Secret Service \(soundtrack\)")_, and he watched various opening
credit sequences from the series for inspiration while mixing the track.[8]

The soundtrack was released by [J Records](/wiki/J_Records "J Records"), Keys'
record label, though Keys appears on only one track. The track listing follows
the order of the music's use within the film, with the exception of the title
song being moved to the end of the album (in the film, it appears immediately
after track 1). It is presented in the full-length single-release version,
rather than the shorter mix heard over the film's opening titles. One notable
omission is the fully orchestrated [James Bond Theme](/wiki/James_Bond_Theme
"James Bond Theme"), which features, as it did in _[Casino
Royale](/wiki/Casino_Royale_\(2006_film\) "Casino Royale \(2006 film\)")_ ,
only at the film's conclusion, but this time over the traditional [gunbarrel
walk-on-and-shoot](/wiki/James_Bond_gun_barrel_sequence "James Bond gun barrel
sequence") as well as the start of the end titles. Another omission is [Four
Tet](/wiki/Four_Tet "Four Tet")'s instrumental closing theme that follows it,
playing over the remainder of the credits and entitled _Crawl, End Crawl_
within them. This track was later made available on iTunes. Other tracks
listed are heard in the film (but not on the album) during scenes such as
[Dominic Greene](/wiki/Dominic_Greene "Dominic Greene")'s charity fundraising
party _[Jaime Cuadra](/wiki/Jaime_Cuadra "Jaime Cuadra") \- Cholo Soy_,
_[Jaime Cuadra](/wiki/Jaime_Cuadra "Jaime Cuadra") \- Regresa_, _[Jaime
Cuadra](/wiki/Jaime_Cuadra "Jaime Cuadra") \- El Provinciano_; and
[Puccini](/wiki/Puccini "Puccini")'s [opera](/wiki/Opera "Opera")
_[Tosca](/wiki/Tosca "Tosca")_ forms the backdrop to a key sequence. _Vesper
's Theme_ from Arnold's [_Casino Royale_
soundtrack](/wiki/Casino_Royale_\(2006_soundtrack\) "Casino Royale \(2006
soundtrack\)") reappears at key moments in the film; it may be heard on the
album in tracks 12, 15, 18 and 23.
